page.title: 01NAPTON-ON-THE-HILL
page.content: Napton-on-the-Hill is an attractive village in Warwickshire. The name suggests that it was a Saxon settlement as the word 'ton' is the Saxon word meaning settlement and 'knap' means on the top. The hill reaches 500ft and on a clear day 4 counties can be seen. A noticeable landmark is a windmill which is now a private residence. Over the years the village was gradually extended until by 1841 the population had reached 951. Although it declined during the general depression which hit the agricultural workers in the late 1800's it has risen steadily since the second world war and is now over 1000.There are 3 shops, 3 pubs and an attractive village green. It is a lively, friendly community with many social events in the Church, Village Hall and School.
